channel.title: TSNPerf | Creator's Landing Page | Hugo Theme

item.title: üéâ How to contribute
item.description:
Reporting a bug

File bugs in the Github Issue Tracker. Please follow these guidelines:

  • Search existing issues first, make sure yours hasn’t already been reported.
  • Consider enabling debug mode so that you can provide as much details as possible when reporting the issue.
  • Stay on topic, but describe the issue in detail so that others can reproduce it.
  • Provide a screenshot if possible. A screenshot showing the problem is often more useful than a paragraph describing it.

The development team will only answer questions on github issues and reject other forms of questions.

Contributing to ZIGGO’s code

If you want to start contributing to the project’s code, please follow these guidelines before creating a pull request:

  • The top post of the pull request should contain a full, self-contained explanation of the feature: what it does, how it does it, with examples of usage and screenshots. Also explain why you want to add this - what problem does it solve. Do not simply add a text Implement feature #4345 , because the information there will most likely be outdated or confusing (multiple discussions and opinions). The pull request needs to be self-contained.
  • Bug fixes are always welcome.
  • A good way to easily start contributing is to pick and work on a good first issue. We try to make these issues as clear as possible and provide basic info on how the code should be changed, and if something is unclear feel free to ask for more information on the issue.
  • Before adding a new feature, ask about it in the Github Issue Tracker , or check if existing discussions exist to make sure the new functionality is desired.
  • Pull requests that make many changes using an automated tool, like for spell fixing, styling, etc. will not be accepted.
  • Pull requests that address multiple issues will most likely stall and eventually be closed. This is because we might be fine with one of the changes but not with others and untangling that kind of pull request is too much hassle both for maintainers and the person who submitted it. So most of the time someone gives up and the PR gets closed. So please keep the pull request focused on one issue.
  • Do not mark your reviewer’s comments as “resolved”. If you do that, the comments will be hidden and the reviewer will not know what are the pending issues in the pull request. Only the reviewer should resolve the comments.

item.title: üëçHardwareÔºöBuild the CaaS Device
item.description:
Before Start

If you just want to teach the board to run instead of modifying it, and you use the hardware files we provide, you can skip directly to step SD card partition and copy file.

Table of Content

  • Before Start
  • Table of Content
  • Install Vivado
  • Vivado project construction
  • Petalinux
    • 1.install ubuntu OS
    • 2.Download PetaLinux related image files in advance
    • 3.Activate the PetaLinux environment
    • 4.Create PetaLinux Project
    • 5.Petalinux Configuration
    • 6. SD card partition and copy file
      • File downloading
      • SD card partition
      • Copy files into SD card
  • Launch the Board and log in
    • 1. Launch the Board
    • 2. Initialize PS
    • 3. Connect to Internet
    • 4. Run the Software

Install Vivado

You can download Vivado here.

We are using Vivado version 2020.1 (note: a unified version is required, otherwise running may cause problems).

Vivado project construction

  1. clone the git repository for the hardware part.
  2. Open Vivado and enter the command cd Porject_Dir in Tcl Console and source ./tsn_device.tcl. After the command is executed, Vivado will automatically open the created project. Here, we will first close Vivado and rename the folder where the project is located to Work_ Dir, so that git can correctly ignore this directory and enter Work_ Dir, double-click the .xpr file to open the project again.

  1. Click Generate Bitstream

  1. Export the xsa file. In Vivado, File Export Export Hardware. Select Fixed for Platform type. Select include bitstream for Output. Click Finish to export the xsa file.

    Exported xsa file path: Work_Dir/tns+tsn_device.xsa

Petalinux

1.install ubuntu OS

The following compilation processes are all completed within the virtual machine.

We recommend using the following configuration:

Virtual machine version: VMware Workstation 16 Pro
Ubuntu version: ubuntu-16.04.3-desktop-amd64.iso

2.Download PetaLinux related image files in advance

Enter website: https://www.xilinx.com/support/download/index.html/content/xilinx/en/downloadNav/embedded-design-tools/archive.html

Select 2020.1 to find PetaLinux Tools sstate-cache artifacts and download sstate_ arm_ 2020.1 and downloads and save the downloads in a specified directory in the virtual machine on January 2021 (the directory for this document is set to/home/alinx/data/)

‚Äã

3.Activate the PetaLinux environment

source /opt/pkg/petalinux/settings.sh

‚Äã Automatically activate the PetaLinux environment every time Terminal is started.

4.Create PetaLinux Project

petalinux-create --type project --template zynq --name <project_name>
cd <project_name>

5.Petalinux Configuration

  1. Import Hardware Configuration
petalinux-config --get-hw-description <PATH-TO-XSA Directory>

Then you will enter the menuconfig page and configure as follows:

Subsystem AUTO Hardware Settings
-> Ethernet Settings  
  -> [*] Randomise MAC address

Image Packaging Configurations 
-> Root filesystem type 
  -> [*] EXT4 (SD/eMMC/SATA/USB)

Yocto Settings (Use downloaded image)
-> Local sstate feeds settings: /home/alinx/data/sstate_arm_2020.1/arm
-> Add pre-mirror url: file:///home/alinx/data/downloads
  1. make Kernel Module

‚Äã make a module named “dma proxy”:

petalinux-create -t modules -n dma-proxy --enable

‚Äã replace the dma-proxy folder:

rm -rf project-spec/meta-user/recipes-modules/*

download our dma-proxy (from here) and unzip in project-spec/meta-user/recipes-modules/

  1. Configuring the kernel
petalinux-config -c kernel

Entering the menuconfig page, and do:

Device Drivers 
-> Userspace I/O drivers 
  -> [*] Userspace I/O platform driver with generic IRQ handling 
  -> [*] Userspace platform driver with generic irq and dynamic memory 
  -> [*] Xilinx AI Engine driverDevice Drivers 
-> Dma Engine Support  
  -> [*] Xilinx DMA Engines
-> Network device support    
  -> Ethernet driver support        
    -> [*] Cadence devices        
    -> [*] Cadence MACB/GEM support

General setup 
-> Preemption Model    
  -> (X) No Forced Preemption (Server)
  1. Configuring rootfs

Edit file project-spec/meta-user/conf/user-rootfsconfig, and add the following configuration:

CONFIG_sudo
CONFIG_sudo-dev
CONFIG_dnf
CONFIG_packagegroup-core-buildessential
CONFIG_packagegroup-core-buildessential-dev
CONFIG_packagegroup-self-hosted
CONFIG_packagegroup-self-hosted-dev
CONFIG_packagegroup-self-hosted-sdk-dev
CONFIG_packagegroup-self-hosted-sdk
CONFIG_python3
CONFIG_autoconf
CONFIG_autoconf-dev
CONFIG_automake
CONFIG_automake-dev
CONFIG_bison
CONFIG_bison-dev
CONFIG_flex
CONFIG_flex-dev
CONFIG_make
CONFIG_make-dev
CONFIG_python
CONFIG_libtool
CONFIG_libtool-dev
CONFIG_sqlite3
CONFIG_cmake
CONFIG_util-linux
CONFIG_net-tools

Save and exit.

Input:

petalinux-config -c rootfs

Then you will enter the menuconfig page and configure as follows:

Image Features 
-> [*] package management   
  -> (http://petalinux.xilinx.com/sswreleases/rel-v2020/feeds/zc702-zynq7/) Package feed url.
user packages
-> SELECT ALL
  1. Compile the device tree
petalinux-build -c device-tree
  1. Modify the device tree

The generated device tree is located in components/plnx_workspace/device tree/device tree/pl.dtsi directory, we need to make modifications based on this file to meet some of our peripheral needs. The modified files are stored in the project-spec/meta user/recipes bsp/device tree/files/system-user.dtsi directory.

Note: Between the //>>> and //<<< is the content added between the comments.

/include/ "system-conf.dtsi"
/ {
        amba_pl: amba_pl {
                dma_proxy {  
            compatible ="xlnx,dma_proxy";
            dmas = <&axi_dma_0 0  &axi_dma_0 1>;
            dma-names = "dma_proxy_tx", "dma_proxy_rx";  
        };
                pkt_gen_controller_0: pkt_gen_controller@43c00000 {
                        compatible = "generic-uio","uio";
                        reg = <0x43c00000 0x10000>;
                };
                rtc0: time_sync_uio@43c10000 {
                        compatible = "generic-uio","uio";
                        reg = <0x43c10000 0x10000>;
                };
        };
        chosen{
                        bootargs = "console=ttyPS0,115200 earlyprintk cma=256M uio_pdrv_genirq.of_id=generic-uio root=/dev/mmcblk0p2 rw rootwait";
      stdout-path = "serial0:115200n8";
        };
};
&gem1 {
    local-mac-address = [00 00 00 00 02 01];
    phy-mode = "gmii";
    fixed-link {
        speed = <1000>;
        full-duplex;
    };
};
  1. Complie
petalinux-build
  1. Pack

Here, you need to copy the bitstream file generated by Vivado to the virtual machine. (You can export bitstream file to where you want).

Then:

cd images/linux
petalinux-package --boot --fsbl zynq_fsbl.elf --fpga <FPGA bitstream path> --u-boot --force

After that, you can get 4 key file: BOOT.BIN boot.scr image.ub rootfs.tar.gz

6. SD card partition and copy file

File downloading

Download the following file from this public link or from preceding steps:

  • BOOT.BIN
  • boot.scr
  • image.ub
  • rootfs.tar.gz

SD card partition

In order to boot the TSNPerf, you are supposed to have a micro SD card with >32GiB storage. Then use:

sudo apt-get install gparted
sudo gparted

Parition it into two partition below

  • BOOT: store boot files from petalinux

    Free space preceding (MiB): 4

    New size (MiB): 500

    File system: fat32

    Label: BOOT

  • ROOTFS: store debian system rootfs

    Free space preceding (MiB): 0

    Free space following (MiB): 0

    File system: ext4

    Label: ROOTFS

Copy files into SD card

Mound SD card:

sudo mount /dev/sda1 /media/alinx/BOOT/
sudo mount /dev/sda2 /media/alinx/ROOTFS/

Remove original files:

sudo rm -rf /media/alinx/BOOT/* /media/alinx/ROOTFS/*

Copy files:

sudo cp BOOT.BIN boot.scr image.ub /media/alinx/BOOT

sudo tar -zxvf rootfs.tar.gz -C /media/alinx/ROOTFS
sudo cp -r ~/init_os.sh /media/alinx/ROOTFS/home/root/init_os.sh 
sync
sudo chown root:root /media/alinx/ROOTFS
sudo chmod 755 /media/alinx/ROOTFS

Launch the Board and log in

1. Launch the Board

Plug the SD card into FPGA board, turn the switch to SD card boot mode.

2. Initialize PS

Plug in SD card, setup AX7021 board to boot on SD, power on.

Connect a PC to the UART port of the board. We recommend using MobaXterm to connect the serial. Set up the Speed to 115200, Flow Control to None.

The default username and password are as follows:

username: "root"
password: "root"

Execute the initilization script to set up the linux environment. (hardware/init_os.sh)

sh init_os.sh

You can freely configure the host name, IP address, and MAC address, etc with the script, and can modify the script if needed.

3. Connect to Internet

Connect the PC’s network port to the device’s PS network port (ETH0).

Set up PC’s corresponding port to be in the same subnet with the device (i.e., 192.168.137.x).

Afterwards, you can connect to the device through ssh and copy any Software files needed.

4. Run the Software

Please refer to the software part of this repo for further instructions.

item.title: üë©üèº‚Äçüè´ ÂáÜÂ§áÊ∏ÖÂçï
item.description:
ËΩØ‰ª∂ÁéØÂ¢ÉÊ∏ÖÂçï

Vivada ÂºÄÂèëÁéØÂ¢É

Vivado ÊòØÂºÄÂèëÊùøÁöÑÁ°¨‰ª∂ÂºÄÂèëÁ®ãÂ∫è„ÄÇ

Vivado ËΩØ‰ª∂ÁöÑ Xilinx ÂÆòÊñπ‰∏ãËΩΩÂú∞ÂùÄÔºö http://china.xilinx.com/support/download.html

Êú¨ÂºÄÂèëÂõ¢Èòü‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÊòØVivado 2020.1ÁâàÊú¨ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Âª∫ËÆÆZIGGOÈ°πÁõÆ‰ΩøÁî®ËÄÖ‰πü‰ΩøÁî®Áõ∏ÂêåÁâàÊú¨‰ª•ÂÖç‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∏çÂøÖË¶ÅÁöÑÈ∫ªÁÉ¶„ÄÇ

ÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑÂÆâË£ÖÊµÅÁ®ãÂèØ‰ª•ÂèÇÁÖß ZYNQÂ∫îÁî®ÊïôÁ®ã Á¨¨‰∏âÁ´†VivadoÂºÄÂèëÁéØÂ¢É ËøõË°åÂÆâË£Ö„ÄÇ

MobaXterm

MobaXtermÊòØ‰∏≤Âè£ËøûÊé•Â∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Âú®hardware_build.md‰∏≠‚ÄúLaunch the Board and log in‚ÄùËøô‰∏ÄÁ´†ËäÇËøõË°å‰∫Ü‰ΩøÁî®‰ªãÁªç„ÄÇ

MobaXtermÁöÑÂÆòÊñπ‰∏ãËΩΩÂú∞ÂùÄÔºöMobaXterm Xserver with SSH, telnet, RDP, VNC and X11 - Download (mobatek.net)

Á°¨‰ª∂ÂáÜÂ§áÊ∏ÖÂçï

Alinx7021ÂºÄÂèëÊùø

SDÂêØÂä®Âç°

SDÂêØÂä®Âç°‰∏≠Â≠òÂÇ®ÁùÄÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåÂª∫ËÆÆÂÆπÈáè $\geq$ 32G„ÄÇ

ÂøÖË¶ÅÁöÑÁ∫øÊùê

ÂåÖÊã¨ÁΩëÁ∫ø„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÁ∫øÁ≠â„ÄÇ

ÊôÆÈÄö‰∫§Êç¢Êú∫

Â¶ÇÊûú‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÂºÄÂèëÊùøÊï∞ÈáèËæÉÂ§öÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ËÄÉËôëÂ∞ÜÊâÄÊúâÂºÄÂèëÊùøËøûÊé•Âà∞ÊôÆÈÄö‰∫§Êç¢Êú∫ÂÜçÈÄöËøáÊôÆÈÄö‰∫§Êç¢Êú∫ËøûÊé•Ëá≥PCÔºàÈÄöËøáÁΩëÁ∫øÔºâËøõË°åÁÆ°ÁêÜÂíå‰ΩøÁî®„ÄÇ

item.title: üìà TSNPerf ‰ΩøÁî®ÊåáÂçó
item.description:
Á°¨‰ª∂ÂáÜÂ§á

ÂáÜÂ§á‰∏§Âè∞Êú∫Âô®Ôºå‰∏ÄÂè∞‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂèëÈÄÅÊñπPublisherÔºå‰∏ÄÂè∞‰Ωú‰∏∫Êé•Êî∂ÊñπRecorderÔºåÊØè‰∏ÄÂè∞‰∏äÁöÑÁ°¨‰ª∂ÈúÄÊª°Ë∂≥‰ª•‰∏ãÊù°‰ª∂

  • Intel ÂÖ´‰ª£Âèä‰ª•‰∏äÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜÂô®
  • Intel I210 / I225-LM / I225-LM ÁΩëÂç°

Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºöPublisher‰∏äÈúÄË¶ÅÂÆâË£Ö‰∏§‰∏™ÁΩëÂç°Ôºå‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë¥üË¥£Êó∂Èó¥ÂêåÊ≠•Ôºå‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë¥üË¥£ÂèëÈÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖ„ÄÇRecorder‰∏äÂè™Ë¶ÅÂÆâË£Ö‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁΩëÂç°ÔºåËØ•ÁΩëÂç°ÂêåÊó∂Ë¥üË¥£Êó∂Èó¥ÂêåÊ≠•ÂíåÊï∞ÊçÆÊé•Êî∂„ÄÇ

Á≥ªÁªüÂáÜÂ§á

Âú®ÂèëÈÄÅÂèëÂíåÊé•Êî∂ÊñπÁöÑÊú∫Âô®‰∏äÔºåÂÆâË£Ö‰ª•‰∏ãÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏éËΩØ‰ª∂‰æùËµñ

  • ÂÆâË£Ö Ubuntu 22.04
  • ÂÆâË£Ö Intel ECI https://eci.intel.com/docs/3.1/getstarted/requirements.html
  • ÂÆâË£ÖlinuxPTPÔºåÂèÇËÄÉ‰∏ã‰∏ÄÁ´†ËäÇ
  • ÂÆâË£Ö‰æùËµñ
sudo apt-get install libconfig-dev libpcap-dev

Âú®ËøõË°åÂÆûÈ™åÂâçÔºåËØ∑Â∞ÜÂæÖÊµãËÆæÂ§á‰∏éPublisher„ÄÅRecorderÊåâÁÖßÂêàÈÄÇÁöÑÊñπÂºèËøûÊé•ÔºåÂπ∂ÂºÄÊú∫ÂêØÂä®„ÄÇ

ÂêØÁî®Êó∂Èó¥ÂêåÊ≠•

ÂÆâË£ÖlinuxPTP

1. ÂÆâË£ÖÁΩëÂç°È©±Âä®

‰∏ãËΩΩÈ©±Âä®ÔºåÂèÇÁÖßÂéãÁº©ÂåÖ‰∏≠ README ÁöÑÊïôÁ®ãÁºñËØëÂÆâË£ÖÈ©±Âä®„ÄÇ

‰ΩøÁî®‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§Ê£ÄÊü•ÂÆâË£ÖÔºàenp3s0‰∏∫ÁΩëÂç°ÂêçÔºâ„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÂÆâË£ÖÊàêÂäüÔºåÂ∫îÊúâ‰∏ãÂõæÁ∫¢Ê°Ü‰∏≠ÁöÑËæìÂá∫ÔºàË°®Á§∫ÁΩëÂç°ÂÖ∑ÊúâÁ°¨‰ª∂Êó∂Èó¥Êà≥ÂäüËÉΩÔºâÔºö

ethtool -T enp3s0

2. ÂÆâË£ÖlinuxPTP

ÊåâÁÖß‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÂÆâË£ÖlinuxPTP

git clone http://git.code.sf.net/p/linuxptp/code linuxptp
cd linuxptp/
make
sudo make install

ÂêåÊ≠•Publisher‰∏éRecorderÁöÑÁΩëÂç°Êó∂Èíü

Áî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÂêØÂä®PublisherÂíåRecorderÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÂêåÊ≠•ÁΩëÂç°„ÄÇenp3s0‰∏∫ÁΩëÂç°ÂêçÔºå<configuration>.cfg‰∏∫ÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂèØÂèÇËÄÉlinuxptp/configs/‰∏≠ÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂπ∂ÁªìÂêàÈúÄÊ±ÇÂÜôËØ•ÈÖçÁΩÆ„ÄÇ

sudo ptp4l -i enp3s0 -f <configuration>.cfg -m -l 6 --socket_priority 7

Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºöÂ¶ÇÊúâÈúÄË¶ÅÔºåËØ∑ÂêåÊó∂ÂêØÂä®ÂæÖÊµãËÆæÂ§áÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÂêåÊ≠•ÂäüËÉΩ

ÂêåÊ≠•ÁΩëÂç°Êó∂Èíü‰∏éÁ≥ªÁªüÊó∂Èíü

PublisherÂíåRecorderÁöÑ‰∏§Âº†ÁΩëÂç°ÂêåÊ≠•ÂÆåÊàêÂêéÔºåÂÜçÂ∞ÜÁΩëÂç°Êó∂Èíü‰∏éÁ≥ªÁªüÊó∂ÈíüÂêåÊ≠•‰∏ä„ÄÇ

sudo phc2sys -c CLOCK_REALTIME -s enp3s0 -O -0 -m -l 6

Áî±‰∫éPublisher‰∏äÊó∂Èó¥ÂêåÊ≠•‰∏éÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÂèëÈÄÅ‰ΩøÁî®‰∫Ü‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÁΩëÂç°ÔºåËØ∑Â∞ÜÂèëÈÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÁΩëÂç°‰∏äÁöÑÊó∂Èíü‰πü‰∏éÁ≥ªÁªüÂêåÊ≠•‰∏ä

sudo phc2sys -s CLOCK_REALTIME -c enp1s0 -O -0 -m -l 6

‰ºòÂåñÁΩëÁªúÊ†à

Â∞ÜÂÖ≥ÈîÆÊµÅÈáèÁªëÂÆöÂà∞ Queue 0

Âú®PublisherÂíåRecorder‰∏äÊâßË°å‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÂ∞ÜÂÖ≥ÈîÆÊµÅÈáèÁªëÂÆöÂà∞ Queue 0 ‰∏ä„ÄÇ

sudo ethtool --config-ntuple enp1s0 delete 15
sudo ethtool --config-ntuple enp1s0 flow-type ether proto 0xb62c loc 15 action 0
sudo ethtool -X enp1s0 equal 2

Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºö

  1. enp1s0‰ª£Ë°®Publisher‰∏äË¥üË¥£ÂèëÈÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÁΩëÂç°ÔºåÊàñËÄÖRecorder‰∏äÁöÑÁΩëÂç°„ÄÇ
  2. Á¨¨2Ë°åÂëΩ‰ª§‰∏≠ÁöÑ0xb62c‰ª£Ë°®ÂÖ≥ÈîÆÊµÅÈáèÁöÑÁ±ªÂûãÔºåËØ∑‰øùÊåÅËØ•ÂÄº‰∏é‰∏ã‰∏ÄÁ´†ËäÇ‰∏≠ethertype‰∏ÄËá¥„ÄÇ

ÁªëÂÆö Queue 0 ‰∏≠Êñ≠Âà∞ÈöîÁ¶ªÊ†∏ÂøÉÔºåÂπ∂ËÆæÁΩÆ‰ºòÂÖàÁ∫ß

Âú®PublisherÂíåRecorder‰∏äÊâßË°å‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§„ÄÇ

ÁªëÂÆöÂà∞ÈöîÁ¶ªÊ†∏ÂøÉ

cat /proc/interrupts | grep TxRx-0


sudo sh -c "echo 2 > /proc/irq/131/smp_affinity"

ËÆæÁΩÆ‰ºòÂÖàÁ∫ß

ps -ae | grep 131


sudo chrt -fp 95

ÂºÄÂêØ LaunchTime ÂäüËÉΩ

Âú®Publisher‰∏äÂºÄÂêØ LaunchTime ÂäüËÉΩ

sudo tc qdisc add dev enp1s0 handle 8001: parent root mqprio num_tc 4 map 0 1 2 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 3 queues 1@0 1@1 1@2 1@3 hw 0
sudo tc qdisc replace dev enp1s0 parent 8001:1 etf offload clockid CLOCK_TAI delta 500000

‰øÆÊîπÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂

Ê†πÊçÆÊµãËØïÈúÄÊ±ÇÔºå‰øÆÊîπÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂Ôºå‰ª•‰∏ãÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Á§∫‰æãÈÖçÁΩÆ default.ini

mode:                   0
tx-mode:                0
verbose:                true
use-ziggo-analysis:     false
pcap-filename:          "/home/i210/launchtimedemo/captured_10w_1500Byte.pcap"
interface:              "enp1s0"
smac:                   "00:1b:21:77:ac:ae"
dmac:                   "00:1b:21:76:ae:75"
ethertype:              0xb62c
socket-priority:        0
vlan-priority:          0
offset:                 150000
early-offset:           300000
use-launchtime:         true
basetime:               1684559640000000100L
packet-size:            1500
packets-to-send:        100000
interval:               1000000
use-udp:                true
sip:                    "192.168.16.10"
dip:                    "192.168.16.11"
sport:                  10000
dport:                  10000

‰∏ãÈù¢ÊòØÊØè‰∏™ÈÖçÁΩÆÂèÇÊï∞ÁöÑÂê´‰πâÔºö

  • modeÔºöËøêË°åÊ®°ÂºèÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ0 Ë°®Á§∫ÂèëÈÄÅÔºå1 Ë°®Á§∫Êé•Êî∂„ÄÇÁõÆÂâç‰ªÖÊîØÊåÅÂèëÈÄÅÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ
  • tx-modeÔºöÂèëÈÄÅÊ®°ÂºèÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ0 Ë°®Á§∫ ÂÆåÂÖ®ÊåâÁÖßpcapÊñá‰ª∂‰∏≠ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥Êà≥ÔºåÈáçÊîæÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºõ1 Ë°®Á§∫ ÊåâÈ°∫Â∫èÊØèÂë®ÊúüÂèëÈÄÅ‰∏Ä‰∏™pcapÊñá‰ª∂‰∏≠ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºõ2 Ë°®Á§∫ ÊØè‰∏™Âë®ÊúüÂèëÈÄÅ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊûÑÈÄ†ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºõ 3 Ë°®Á§∫ ÂÖ®ÂäõÂêëÁΩëÁªú‰∏≠ÂèëÈÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºàÁî®‰∫éÂ∏¶ÂÆΩ‰øùËØÅÊµãËØïÔºâ„ÄÇ
  • verboseÔºöÊòØÂê¶ËæìÂá∫È¢ùÂ§ñÁöÑ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåBOOLÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ‰∏ªË¶ÅÂåÖÊã¨ÊØèÂèëÂá∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑ Â∫èÂè∑ Âíå tx Êó∂Èó¥Êà≥„ÄÇ
  • use-ziggo-analysisÔºöÊòØÂê¶‰ΩøÁî®ZIGGOÊµãËØïÊ®°ÂºèÔºåBOOLÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî® ZIGGO ÊµãËØïÔºå‰ºöÂ∞Ü tx Êó∂Èó¥Êà≥ ÊâìÂç∞Âú®ethernetÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÁ¨¨20‰∏™Â≠óËäÇÂºÄÂßãÔºà‰ªé0ÁºñÂè∑ÔºâÁöÑ8‰∏™Â≠óËäÇÔºõÂê¶Âàô‰ºö‰ΩøÁî® Intel ÊµãËØïÊ®°ÂºèÔºå‰ºöÂ∞Ü tx Êó∂Èó¥Êà≥ ÊâìÂç∞Âú®Á¨¨26‰∏™Â≠óËäÇÂºÄÂßãÁöÑ8‰∏™Â≠óËäÇÔºõ
  • pcap-filenameÔºöÈúÄË¶ÅÈáçÊîæÁöÑ pcap Êñá‰ª∂ÔºåSTRINGÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÂΩìtx-mode=0/1Êó∂ÊúâÊïà„ÄÇ
  • interfaceÔºöÁΩëÂè£ÂêçÂ≠óÔºåSTRINGÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ
  • smacÔºådmacÔºöÊ∫ê/ÁõÆÁöÑmacÂú∞ÂùÄÔºåSTRINGÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ
  • ethertypeÔºöÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁ±ªÂûãÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÂΩìtx-mode=2/3Êó∂ÊúâÊïà„ÄÇ
  • socket-priority, vlan-priorityÔºöÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁ±ªÂûãÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇvlanÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÂèÇÊï∞ÔºåÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº‰∏∫0„ÄÇÂΩìtx-mode=2/3Êó∂ÊúâÊïà„ÄÇ
  • offsetÔºöÊèêÂâçË∞ÉÁî®sendÁöÑÊó∂ÈïøÔºåÂçï‰ΩçnsÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÂΩìuse-launchtime‰∏∫trueÊó∂ÊúâÊïà„ÄÇ
  • early-offsetÔºöÁªôÁΩëÁªúÊ†àÂ§ÑÁêÜÈ¢ÑÁïôÁöÑÊó∂ÈïøÔºåÂçï‰ΩçnsÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÂΩìuse-launchtime‰∏∫trueÊó∂ÊúâÊïà„ÄÇ
  • use-launchtimeÔºöÊòØÂê¶‰ΩøÁî® launchtimeÔºåBOOLÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÂè™ÊúâÂΩì‰ΩøÁî® launchtime Êó∂ÔºåÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑtxÊó∂Èó¥Êà≥Á≤æÂ∫¶ÊâçÊòØ‰∫öÂæÆÁßíÁ∫ßÂà´„ÄÇÊ≥®ÊÑèÔºöÁõÆÂâçÔºåÂΩì‰∏î‰ªÖÂΩì‰ªÖÊîØÊåÅtx-mode=2Êó∂ÔºåÂèØÂ∞Üuse-launchtimeËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫false„ÄÇ
  • basetimeÔºöINT64Á±ªÂûã„ÄÇÊï¥‰∏™ÁΩëÁªúËÆæÂ§áÂÖ±‰∫´ÁöÑÂü∫ÂáÜÊó∂Èó¥ÔºåÁî®‰∫éË∞ÉÊï¥Êï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÂèëÈÄÅÊó∂Èó¥Ôºå‰∏é‰∫§Êç¢Êú∫ÁöÑÈó®ÊéßÈÖçÂêà„ÄÇ
  • packet-sizeÔºöÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÂ§ßÂ∞èÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÂçï‰ΩçByte„ÄÇÂΩìtx-mode=2/3Êó∂ÊúâÊïà„ÄÇ
  • packets-to-sendÔºöÂèëÈÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÊï∞ÈáèÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ
  • intervalÔºö‰∏Ä‰∏™Âë®ÊúüÁöÑÊó∂ÈïøÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÂçï‰Ωçns„ÄÇÂΩìtx-mode=1/2Êó∂ÊúâÊïà„ÄÇ
  • use-udpÔºöÊòØÂê¶‰ΩøÁî®udpÂ°´ÂÖÖ‰ª•Â§™ÁΩëÊä•ÊñáÔºåBOOLÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÊ≥®ÊÑèÔºöÁõÆÂâçÔºåÂΩì‰∏î‰ªÖÂΩì‰ªÖÊîØÊåÅtx-mode=2/3Êó∂ÔºåÂèØÂ∞Üuse-udpËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫true„ÄÇ
  • sipÔºöÂéüipÂú∞ÂùÄÔºåSTRINGÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÊ≥®ÊÑèipÂú∞ÂùÄÊòØÂ≠óÁ¨¶‰∏≤ÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅÂä†‰∏äÂºïÂè∑„ÄÇ
  • dipÔºöÁõÆÁöÑipÂú∞ÂùÄÔºåSTRINGÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇÊ≥®ÊÑèipÂú∞ÂùÄÊòØÂ≠óÁ¨¶‰∏≤ÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅÂä†‰∏äÂºïÂè∑„ÄÇ
  • sportÔºöÂéüÁ´ØÂè£Âè∑ÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ
  • dportÔºöÁõÆÁöÑÁ´ØÂè£Âè∑ÔºåINTÁ±ªÂûã„ÄÇ

Âú®PublisherÂêØÂä®Êé•Êî∂Á®ãÂ∫è

Êé•Êî∂Á®ãÂ∫èÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî® Intel ÁöÑ txrx-tsn ‰∏≠ÁöÑÊé•Êî∂Ê®°ÂºèÔºåÈÖçÂêà use-ziggo-analysis = falseÔºåÂÖ∂ÊâìÂá∫Êù•ÁöÑ log ÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•ÊãøÂà∞Êï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÂèëÈÄÅÊó∂Èó¥Êà≥ÂíåÊé•Êî∂Êó∂Èó¥Êà≥„ÄÇ ‰ΩÜÊòØÂÆûÈ™å‰∏≠ÂèëÁé∞ÔºåËØ•Á®ãÂ∫è‰∏éiperfÊâìËÉåÊôØÊµÅÈáèÂÜ≤Á™ÅÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ËÄÉËôëÁî®tcpdumpÊäìÂåÖÔºåÂπ∂‰øùÂ≠òÈ´òÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÁöÑ rx Êó∂Èó¥Êà≥ÔºåtxÊó∂Èó¥Êà≥ÂèØ‰ª•‰ªéÂèëÈÄÅÁ´ØÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫èËæìÂá∫Ëé∑ÂæóÔºå‰ªéËÄåËøõË°åÂàÜÊûê„ÄÇ

sudo tcpdump -i <ÁΩëÂè£> ether proto 0xb62c -j adapter_unsynced --time-stamp-precision=nano -s 0 -tttt -w <Â≠òÂÇ®ÁöÑpcapÊñá‰ª∂>

Âú®RecorderÂêØÂä®ÂèëÈÄÅÁ®ãÂ∫è

cd /path/to/launchtimedemo
make
sudo taskset -c 1 chrt -f 92 ./pcap_replay -c ~/launchtimedemo/config.ini

item.title: üéâ How to contribute
item.description:
Reporting a bug

File bugs in the Github Issue Tracker. Please follow these guidelines:

  • Search existing issues first, make sure yours hasn’t already been reported.
  • Consider enabling debug mode so that you can provide as much details as possible when reporting the issue.
  • Stay on topic, but describe the issue in detail so that others can reproduce it.
  • Provide a screenshot if possible. A screenshot showing the problem is often more useful than a paragraph describing it.

The development team will only answer questions on github issues and reject other forms of questions.

Contributing to ZIGGO’s code

If you want to start contributing to the project’s code, please follow these guidelines before creating a pull request:

  • The top post of the pull request should contain a full, self-contained explanation of the feature: what it does, how it does it, with examples of usage and screenshots. Also explain why you want to add this - what problem does it solve. Do not simply add a text Implement feature #4345 , because the information there will most likely be outdated or confusing (multiple discussions and opinions). The pull request needs to be self-contained.
  • Bug fixes are always welcome.
  • A good way to easily start contributing is to pick and work on a good first issue. We try to make these issues as clear as possible and provide basic info on how the code should be changed, and if something is unclear feel free to ask for more information on the issue.
  • Before adding a new feature, ask about it in the Github Issue Tracker , or check if existing discussions exist to make sure the new functionality is desired.
  • Pull requests that make many changes using an automated tool, like for spell fixing, styling, etc. will not be accepted.
  • Pull requests that address multiple issues will most likely stall and eventually be closed. This is because we might be fine with one of the changes but not with others and untangling that kind of pull request is too much hassle both for maintainers and the person who submitted it. So most of the time someone gives up and the PR gets closed. So please keep the pull request focused on one issue.
  • Do not mark your reviewer’s comments as “resolved”. If you do that, the comments will be hidden and the reviewer will not know what are the pending issues in the pull request. Only the reviewer should resolve the comments.

item.title: üìà TSNPerf ËÆæËÆ°ÂéüÁêÜ
item.description:
Áé∞ÊúâÊñπÊ°àÁöÑÂ±ÄÈôê

TSNPerfÊòØ‰∏ÄÊ¨æ‰∏ì‰∏∫Êó∂Èó¥ÊïèÊÑüÁΩëÁªúÔºàTime-Sensitive Networking, TSNÔºâËÆæËÆ°ÁöÑÊÄßËÉΩËØÑÊµãÂ∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÇÂÆÉÊèê‰æõ‰∫ÜÂÖ®Èù¢ÁöÑTSNÁΩëÁªúÊÄßËÉΩËØÑÊµãÂäüËÉΩÔºåËÉΩÂ§üÂ∏ÆÂä©ÁΩëÁªúÂ∑•Á®ãÂ∏àÂíåÁ†îÁ©∂‰∫∫ÂëòÊ∑±ÂÖ•‰∫ÜËß£Âπ∂È™åËØÅTSNÁΩëÁªúËÆæÂ§áÁöÑÊÄßËÉΩÁâπÂæÅ„ÄÇ‰∏∫Ê≠§ÔºåTSNPerfÈúÄË¶ÅËÉΩÂ§üÁ≤æÂáÜÂú∞ÂêëÁΩëÁªú‰∏≠ÂèëÈÄÅÂÖ≥ÈîÆÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºå‰ª•ÊµãËØïËÆæÂ§áÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÂêåÊ≠•ÊÄßËÉΩÂíåÊµÅÈáèÊï¥ÂΩ¢ËÉΩÂäõ„ÄÇÁÑ∂ËÄåÔºåLinuxÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÊèê‰æõÁöÑsend()ÂáΩÊï∞Âè™ËÉΩËææÂà∞ÂæÆÁßíÁ∫ßÁöÑÂèëÂåÖÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÔºåÈöæ‰ª•Êª°Ë∂≥TSNPerfÂØπÈ´òÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÂèëÂåÖÁöÑË¶ÅÊ±Ç„ÄÇ

‰∏∫‰∫ÜÁõ¥ËßÇÂú∞Â±ïÁ§∫send()ÂáΩÊï∞ÁöÑÂèëÂåÖÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÈôêÂà∂ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËøõË°å‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÈ°πÊµãËØï„ÄÇÂú®ÊµãËØï‰∏≠ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰ΩøÁî®send()ÂáΩÊï∞‰ª•1ÊØ´Áßí‰∏∫ËÆæÂÆöÈó¥ÈöîÔºåËøûÁª≠ÂèëÈÄÅ‰∫Ü10000‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆÂåÖ„ÄÇÁÑ∂ÂêéÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËÆ∞ÂΩï‰∫ÜÊØè‰∏§‰∏™Áõ∏ÈÇªÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖ‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÂÆûÈôÖÊó∂Èó¥Èó¥ÈöîÔºåÂπ∂ËÆ°ÁÆó‰∫ÜÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰∏éÈ¢ÑÊúüÁöÑ1ÊØ´ÁßíÈó¥Èöî‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑËØØÂ∑Æ„ÄÇÁªìÊûúÊòæÁ§∫ÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊ≤°Êúâ‰ªª‰ΩïËÉåÊôØËøõÁ®ã/ÊµÅÈáèÁöÑÂπ≤Êâ∞ÔºåÁõ∏ÈÇªÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÈó¥Èöî‰ªªÁÑ∂ËææÂà∞‰∫ÜÊúÄÈ´ò14ÂæÆÁßíÂ∑¶Âè≥„ÄÇÊé•‰∏ãÊù•Êàë‰ª¨ÂàÜÊûêËØ•Áé∞Ë±°ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†„ÄÇ

Â¶Ç‰∏ãÂõæÊâÄÁ§∫ÔºåÂú® $t_0$ Êó∂ÂàªÔºåÁ®ãÂ∫èË∞ÉÁî® send() ÂáΩÊï∞ÂêëÁΩëÁªúÂèëÈÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºå‰ΩÜÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÔºåÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÂú® $t_1$ Êó∂ÂàªÊâç‰ºöË¢´ÂèëÈÄÅÂà∞ÁΩëÁªú‰∏≠Âéª„ÄÇËøôÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ÔºåÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÁΩëÁªúÂçèËÆÆÊ†àÈúÄË¶ÅËä±Ë¥π‰∏ÄÂÆöÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥Â§ÑÁêÜËØ•Êï∞ÊçÆÂåÖ„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Â∞Ü $t_1-t_0$ Áß∞‰πã‰∏∫ÁΩëÁªúÊ†àÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜÊó∂Âª∂ÔºåËøô‰∏™Êó∂Âª∂ÈÄöÂ∏∏Âú®ÂæÆÁßíÁ∫ßÂà´„ÄÇ

Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°à

Intel ÁöÑ I210 / I225 / I226 ÁΩëÂç°ÔºåÊèê‰æõ‰∫Ü LaunchTime ÂäüËÉΩÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Á≤æÂáÜÂú∞ÊéßÂà∂Êï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁ¶ªÂºÄÁΩëÂè£ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÔºàÁêÜËÆ∫Á≤æÂ∫¶Âú® 32 Á∫≥ÁßíÁ∫ßÂà´Ôºâ„ÄÇ

Âà©Áî® LaunchTimeÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÊèêÈ´òÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÂèëÈÄÅÁ≤æÂ∫¶„ÄÇÂ¶Ç‰∏äÂõæÊâÄÁ§∫ÔºåÂØπ‰∫é‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈúÄË¶ÅÂú® $t_0$ Êó∂ÂàªÂèëÂá∫ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºåÊàë‰ª¨È¢ÑÁïô‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥ÁªôÁΩëÁªúÊ†àÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜÊµÅÁ®ãÔºåÊèêÂâçÂú® $t_2$ Êó∂ÂàªÂ∞±Ë∞ÉÁî® send() ÂáΩÊï∞Ôºå‰øùËØÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÂú® $t_0$ ÂâçÂ∞±Âú®ÁΩëÂç°ÁöÑÂá∫ÈòüÂàóÂè£Á≠âÂæÖÔºåLaunchTime ‰ºöÂú®$t_0$Êó∂ÂàªÊâìÂºÄÂá∫ÈòüÂàóÁöÑÈó®ÔºåÂ∞ÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÂèëÂá∫„ÄÇ

ÊÄßËÉΩÈ™åËØÅ

Á±ª‰ººÂú∞ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂºÄÂêØ LaunchTime ÂäüËÉΩÔºå‰ª•1ÊØ´Áßí‰∏∫ËÆæÂÆöÈó¥ÈöîËøûÁª≠ÂèëÈÄÅ10000‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÔºåËÆ∞ÂΩïÊØè‰∏§‰∏™Áõ∏ÈÇªÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖ‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÂÆûÈôÖÊó∂Èó¥Èó¥Èöî‰∏é1ÊØ´Áßí‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑËØØÂ∑Æ„ÄÇ ÁªìÊûúÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÂõæÊâÄÁ§∫ÔºåÊâÄÊúâÊï∞ÊçÆÂåÖÁöÑÂèëÈÄÅÊó∂Èó¥ËØØÂ∑Æ‰∏çË∂ÖËøá100Á∫≥ÁßíÔºåËææÂà∞‰∫ÜTSNPerfÂØπÂèëÂåÖÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÁöÑË¶ÅÊ±Ç

item.title: üë©üèº‚Äçüè´ ÂáÜÂ§áÊ∏ÖÂçï
item.description:
ËΩØ‰ª∂ÁéØÂ¢ÉÊ∏ÖÂçï

Vivada ÂºÄÂèëÁéØÂ¢É

Vivado ÊòØÂºÄÂèëÊùøÁöÑÁ°¨‰ª∂ÂºÄÂèëÁ®ãÂ∫è„ÄÇ

Vivado ËΩØ‰ª∂ÁöÑ Xilinx ÂÆòÊñπ‰∏ãËΩΩÂú∞ÂùÄÔºö http://china.xilinx.com/support/download.html

Êú¨ÂºÄÂèëÂõ¢Èòü‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÊòØVivado 2020.1ÁâàÊú¨ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Âª∫ËÆÆZIGGOÈ°πÁõÆ‰ΩøÁî®ËÄÖ‰πü‰ΩøÁî®Áõ∏ÂêåÁâàÊú¨‰ª•ÂÖç‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∏çÂøÖË¶ÅÁöÑÈ∫ªÁÉ¶„ÄÇ

ÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑÂÆâË£ÖÊµÅÁ®ãÂèØ‰ª•ÂèÇÁÖß ZYNQÂ∫îÁî®ÊïôÁ®ã Á¨¨‰∏âÁ´†VivadoÂºÄÂèëÁéØÂ¢É ËøõË°åÂÆâË£Ö„ÄÇ

MobaXterm

MobaXtermÊòØ‰∏≤Âè£ËøûÊé•Â∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Âú®hardware-build‰∏≠‚ÄúLaunch the Board and log in‚ÄùËøô‰∏ÄÁ´†ËäÇËøõË°å‰∫Ü‰ΩøÁî®‰ªãÁªç„ÄÇ

MobaXtermÁöÑÂÆòÊñπ‰∏ãËΩΩÂú∞ÂùÄÔºöMobaXterm Xserver with SSH, telnet, RDP, VNC and X11 - Download (mobatek.net)

Á°¨‰ª∂ÂáÜÂ§áÊ∏ÖÂçï

Alinx7021ÂºÄÂèëÊùø

SDÂêØÂä®Âç°

SDÂêØÂä®Âç°‰∏≠Â≠òÂÇ®ÁùÄÊìç‰ΩúÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåÂª∫ËÆÆÂÆπÈáè $\geq$ 32G„ÄÇ

ÂøÖË¶ÅÁöÑÁ∫øÊùê

ÂåÖÊã¨ÁΩëÁ∫ø„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÁ∫øÁ≠â„ÄÇ

ÊôÆÈÄö‰∫§Êç¢Êú∫

Â¶ÇÊûú‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÂºÄÂèëÊùøÊï∞ÈáèËæÉÂ§öÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ËÄÉËôëÂ∞ÜÊâÄÊúâÂºÄÂèëÊùøËøûÊé•Âà∞ÊôÆÈÄö‰∫§Êç¢Êú∫ÂÜçÈÄöËøáÊôÆÈÄö‰∫§Êç¢Êú∫ËøûÊé•Ëá≥PCÔºàÈÄöËøáÁΩëÁ∫øÔºâËøõË°åÁÆ°ÁêÜÂíå‰ΩøÁî®„ÄÇ
